body:
I think a lot of people having this concern and question: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/919

i will update the website soon, i think you are expecting the form to be controlled, but indeed it's not, watch() API is not same as state, watch is for watching input change after input rendered.

Ah ok, I only included `watch` to compare the values side by side. The values inside of `fields` are what I was trying to point out. I removed `watch` from the codesandbox example. It's possible I'm misunderstanding something, in which case I wouldn't mind seeing that updated documentation. ðŸ˜„
I may have a work around, will try out tonight

issue.title: watch removed field on useFieldArray

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
watched values on array fields seemed to be reset to their default value since there is another rendering

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-o61yj
2. Add some amount on the first line
3. Append a new line and another amounts
4. Append a third line
5. Delete any line
6. See the subtotals being reset to 0
7. Change any amount, the subtotals will be recalculated

body: some good progress @ryanwalters try this CSB: https://codesandbox.io/s/bold-sound-7lej4

issue.title: useFieldArray replacing entire array with invidual objects

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
Hi team, first of all thanks for the hook, you've made porting my application over to hooks a pleasure.

I'm having an issue with useFieldArray whereby simply appending an item to the array seems to serialise the array and add each as a seperate value in the parent form.

I've forked your example sandbox and added a `JSON.stringify` to print the form state to illustrate the issue. To reproduce, simple use the `append` button and pay attention to the new state of the form being printed.

https://codesandbox.io/s/react-hook-form-usefieldarray-2hdro

**Expected behavior**
Appending/prepending objects to the array should do exactly that, not add these as individual values of the parent state.

 - OS: macOS High Sierra 10.13.6
 - Chrome 79.0.3945.130

I had a brief look at the source, and the append function looks fine to me. ðŸ¤·â€â™‚ Although, I've not dug too much and my typescript experience is minimal.

Thanks in advance!

rename.from: Unexpected fields values with useFieldArray when defaultValue is set
rename.to: Unexpected fields values with useFieldArray when watch fields

body:
I'll give it a look at some point today. Thanks for the speedy turnaround!

Edit:
I updated my codesandbox to use `react-hook-form@4.7.3-next.0` and the issue still exists.

I think there was a miscommunication somewhere. I see you updated the title of this issue, but my issue wasn't with watch, it was with the value that `fields` receives when setting `defaultValues`.

Please see the output of my codesandbox and my comment above with a possible fix. I can also create a PR if that's easier.

> Digging into this a little bit, it looks like the issue stems from `appendId` (see [mapIds.ts#L12](/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/master/src/logic/mapIds.ts#L12)). That function spreads `value`, which doesn't work as intended with string values. This would seem to only work when `fields` is an array of objects, and give inconsistent results for other values (e.g. array of strings, array of arrays).

yes we only support `objects`

sorry for not reading your issue carefully... that was my bad. yes, right now we don't only support object due to the nature of uncontrolled inputs which required unique id during mapping. I will update documentation accordingly. apologize for not reading your issue carefully, I get overwhelmed by issue around watch() and assume the issue was the same.

> yes we only support `objects`

Are you open to supporting strings and arrays as well as objects? It seems like a useful feature to me (obviously ðŸ˜„). We can probably work out an API that is not a breaking change.

The change I proposed above would be a breaking change, but seems cleaner to me. A non-breaking solution would be to set a `value` property only when the incoming `value` is not an object. I'm happy to open a PR for either solution, just let me know.

> > yes we only support `objects`
> 
> Are you open to supporting strings and arrays as well as objects? It seems like a useful feature to me (obviously ðŸ˜„). We can probably work out an API that is not a breaking change.
> 
> The change I proposed above would be a breaking change, but seems cleaner to me. A non-breaking solution would be to set a `value` property only when the incoming `value` is not an object. I'm happy to open a PR for either solution, just let me know.

hey @ryanwalters I guess it's tradeoff with FieldArray uncontrolled, because it will need to be an object which contains a unique ID for the `map`, however if you have better suggestion or idea why not! :)
